column5: Title

column9: Implementation

column5: Initialization Check in Initialization Procedure of Base Component
column6: Always returns: 'check successful'
column9: The Base Component is not available for direct use by application developers. This Adaptation Point is therefore not directly supported by the C2 Implementation but, where required, is supported by components which are derived from the Base Component.

column5: Initialization Action in Initialization Procedure of Base Component
column6: Do nothing and return: 'action successful'
column9: The Base Component is not available for direct use by application developers. This Adaptation Point is therefore not directly supported by the C2 Implementation but, where required, is supported by components which are derived from the Base Component.

column5: Configuration Check in Reset Procedure of Base Component
column6: Always returns: 'check successful'
column9: The Base Component is not available for direct use by application developers. This Adaptation Point is therefore not directly supported by the C2 Implementation but, where required, is supported by components which are derived from the Base Component.

column5: Configuration Action in Reset Procedure of Base Component
column6: Do nothing and return: 'action successful'
column9: The Base Component is not available for direct use by application developers. This Adaptation Point is therefore not directly supported by the C2 Implementation but, where required, is supported by components which are derived from the Base Component.

column5: Shutdown Action of Base Component
column6: Do nothing
column9: The Base Component is not available for direct use by application developers. This Adaptation Point is therefore not directly supported by the C2 Implementation but, where required, is supported by components which are derived from the Base Component.

column5: Execution Procedure of Base Component
column6: Do the same dummy action (return without doing anything) whenever the procedure is executed
column9: The Base Component is not available for direct use by application developers. This Adaptation Point is therefore not directly supported by the C2 Implementation but, where required, is supported by components which are derived from the Base Component.

column5: \texttt{Make} Operation to dynamically instantiate a component
column6: No default provided at framework level
column9: The only components which can be instantiated dynamically are report and command components. Their \texttt{make} operations are implemented in full (see \texttt{CrFwInFactoryMake*} and \texttt{CrFwOutFactoryMakeOutCmp} functions). This adaptation point is therefore closed by the C2 Implementation.

column5: \texttt{Release} Operation to dynamically release a component
column6: No default provided at framework level
column9: The only components which can be released  dynamically are report and command components. Their \texttt{release} operations are implemented in full (see \texttt{CrFwInFactoryRelease*} and \texttt{CrFwOutFactoryReleaseOutCmp} functions). This adaptation point is therefore closed by the C2 Implementation.

column5: Operations to Set and Get the Values of Command and Report Attributes in a Packet
column9: Implementation of \texttt{CrFwPckt.h}. Only a test stub is provided as default at framework level.

column5: Operations to Report Errors Values of Command and Report Attributes in a Packet
column9: Implementation of \texttt{CrFwRepErr.h}. Only a test stub is provided as default at framework level.

column5: OutFactory Capacity
column9: \texttt{\#DEFINE} constant in \texttt{CrFwOutFactoryUserPar.h} defines maximum number of OutComponents which can be allocated by the factory.

column5: OutComponent Kinds
column9: \texttt{\#DEFINE} constants in \texttt{CrFwOutFactoryUserPar.h} define the kinds of OutComponents supported by the application. An OutComponent kind is defined through its service type, command or report sub-type, and discriminant value. For each supported OutComponent kind, function pointers are defined implementing the OutComponent checks and actions.

column5: InFactory Capacity for InReports
column9: \texttt{\#DEFINE} constant in \texttt{CrFwInFactoryUserPar.h} defines maximum number of InReports which can be allocated by the factory.

column5: InFactory Capacity for InCommands
column9: \texttt{\#DEFINE} constant in \texttt{CrFwInFactoryUserPar.h} defines maximum number of InCommands which can be allocated by the factory.

column5: InReport Kinds
column9: \texttt{\#DEFINE} constants in \texttt{CrFwInFactoryUserPar.h} define the kinds of InReports supported by the application. An InReport kind is defined through its service type, command or report sub-type, and discriminant value. For each supported InReport kind, function pointers are defined implementing the InReport checks and actions.

column5: InCommand Kinds
column9: \texttt{\#DEFINE} constants in \texttt{CrFwInFactoryUserPar.h} define the kinds of InCommands supported by the application. An InCommand kind is defined through its service type, command or report sub-type, and discriminant value. For each supported InCommand kind, function pointers are defined implementing the InCommand checks and actions.

column6: Same value as in Base Component

column5: Initialization Action in Initialization Procedure of OutComponent
column6: Same value as in Base Component
column9: OutComponents are provided by the OutFactory in the CONFIGURED state and cannot therefore be initialized and configured by the user. This adaptation point is closed in the C2 Implementation.

column5: Configuration Check in Reset Procedure of OutComponent
column6: Same value as in Base Component
column9: OutComponents are provided by the OutFactory in the CONFIGURED state and cannot therefore be initialized and configured by the user. This adaptation point is closed in the C2 Implementation.

column5: Configuration Action in Reset Procedure of OutComponent
column6: Same value as in Base Component
column9: OutComponents are provided by the OutFactory in the CONFIGURED state and cannot therefore be initialized and configured by the user. This adaptation point is closed in the C2 Implementation.

column5: Shutdown Action in Base Component of OutComponent
column6: Same value as in Base Component
column9: OutComponents are provided by the OutFactory in the CONFIGURED state and are not intended to be ever shut down. This adaptation point is closed in the C2 Implementation.

column5: Execution Procedure of OutComponent (closes BAS-6)
column6: Same value as in Base Component
column9: The OutComponents are not intended to be ever executed. This adaptation point is closed in the C2 Implementation.

column5: Service Type Attribute of OutComponent
column6: No default provided at framework level
column9: This Adaptation Point is implemented by adaptation point OFA-2.

column5: Command/Report Sub-Type Attribute of OutComponent

column9: This Adaptation Point is implemented by adaptation point OFA-2.

column5: Destination Attribute of OutComponent
column6: No default provided at framework level
column9: This Adaptation Point is implemented by adaptation point OFA-2.

column5: Acknowledge Level Attribute of OutComponent
column6: Default value is: 'no acknowledge required' (only relevant for OutCommands)
column9: This Adaptation Point is implemented by adaptation point C2-PCK-1.

column5: Discriminant Attribute of OutComponent
column6: Default value is: 'no discriminant'
column9: This Adaptation Point is implemented by adaptation point OFA-2.

column5: Parameter Attribute of OutComponent
column6: Default value is: 'no parameters'
column9: This Adaptation Point is implemented indirectly: applications must extend OutComponents and must define the range of parameters for each OutComponent and the operations to set their values.

column5: Enable Check Operation of OutComponent
column6: Query the OutRegistry for the enable status of the command or report encapsulated in the OutComponent and set value of isEnable accordingly
column9: \texttt{\#DEFINE} constants (one for each kind of OutComponent in the application) in \texttt{CrFwOutFactoryUserPar.h} define the pointer to the function implementing the operation. A default is provided a framework level.

column5: Ready Check Operation of OutComponent
column6: Set value of isReady flag to true
column9: \texttt{\#DEFINE} constants (one for each kind of OutComponent in the application) in \texttt{CrFwOutFactoryUserPar.h} define the pointer to the function implementing the operation. A default is provided a framework level.

column5: Repeat Check Operation of OutComponent
column6: Return “No Repeat”
column9: \texttt{\#DEFINE} constants (one for each kind of OutComponent in the application) in \texttt{CrFwOutFactoryUserPar.h} define the pointer to the function implementing the operation. A default is provided a framework level.

column5: Update Action of OutComponent
column6: Set Time Stamp of OutComponent to current time
column9: \texttt{\#DEFINE} constants (one for each kind of OutComponent in the application) in \texttt{CrFwOutFactoryUserPar.h} define the pointer to the function implementing the operation. A default is provided a framework level.

column6: No default defined at framework level
column9: \texttt{\#DEFINE} constants (one for each kind of OutComponent in the application) in \texttt{CrFwOutFactoryUserPar.h} define the pointer to the function implementing the operation. A default is provided a framework level.

column5: Operation to Report Invalid Destination of an OutComponent
column6: Generate SNDPCKT\_INV\_DEST Error Report with invalid destination as a parameter
column9: Implemented by Adaptation Point C2-ERR-1.

column5: Initialization Check in Initialization Procedure of OutLoader
column6: Returns 'check successful' if the size of the LOM (List of OutManagers) has been set to a positive integer value.
column9: Function pointer in \texttt{CrFwOutLoaderUserPar.h}. Default implementation which always returns 'check successful' is provided in \texttt{CrFwOutLoader.h}.

column5: Initialization Action in Initialization Procedure  of OutLoader
column6: Allocate resources for LOM and return 'Action Successful' iff the allocation succeeds
column9: Function pointer in \texttt{CrFwOutLoaderUserPar.h}. Default implementation which takes no action is provided in \texttt{CrFwOutLoader.h}.

column5: Configuration Check in Reset Procedure of OutLoader
column6: Returns 'check successful' iff all the information is available to update (or initialize) the value of the LOM.
column9: Function pointer in \texttt{CrFwOutLoaderUserPar.h}. Default implementation which always returns 'check successful' is provided in \texttt{CrFwOutLoader.h}.

column5: Configuration Action in Reset Procedure of OutLoader
column6: Update (or initialize) the LOM and return 'Action Successful'
column9: Function pointer in \texttt{CrFwOutLoaderUserPar.h}. Default implementation which takes no action is provided in \texttt{CrFwOutLoader.h}.

column5: Shutdown Action of OutLoader
column6: Same as in Base Component.
column9: Function pointer in \texttt{CrFwOutLoaderUserPar.h}. Default implementation which takes no action is provided in \texttt{CrFwOutLoader.h}.

column5: Execution Procedure of OutLoader (closes BAS-6)
column6: Same as in Base Component.
column9: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.

column5: OutManager Selection Operation
column6: Select the first OutManager in the LOM
column9: Function pointer in \texttt{CrFwOutLoaderUserPar.h}. Default implementation which always returns the first OutManager in the LOM is provided in \texttt{CrFwOutLoader.h}.

column5: OutManager Activation Operation
column6: Do nothing
column9: Function pointer in \texttt{CrFwOutLoaderUserPar.h}. Default implementation which takes no action is provided in \texttt{CrFwOutLoader.h}.

column5: Operation to set Set Time-Stamp in Outgoing Packets
column6: No value defined at framework level
column9: Implemented by Adaptation Point C2-PCK-1.

column9: \texttt{\#DEFINE} constants in \texttt{CrFwOutManagerUserPar.h}

column6: Default size is 1.
column9: \texttt{\#DEFINE} constants (one for each OutManager) in \texttt{CrFwOutManagerUserPar.h}

column6: Returns 'check successful' if the size of the POCL has been set to a positive integer value.
column9: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.

column5: Initialization Action in Initialization Procedure of OutManager (closes BAS-2)
column6: Allocate resources for POCL and return 'Action Successful' iff the allocation succeeds
column9: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.

column5: Configuration Check in Reset Procedure of OutManager (closes BAS-3)
column6: Same as in Base Component
column9: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.

column5: Configuration Action in Reset Procedure  (closes BAS-4)
column6: Release all OutComponents in the POCL; reset the POCL; reset the counter of successfully loaded OutComponents; and return 'Action Successful'
column9: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.

column5: Shutdown Action in Base Component of OutManager (closes BAS-5)
column6: Release all OutComponents in the POCL; reset the POCL
column9: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.

column5: Execution Procedure in Base Component of OutManager (closes BAS-6)
column6: Implemented as procedure of Manager Execution Procedure
column9: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.

column6: Generate OUTMANAGER\_POCL\_FULL Error Report
column9: Implemented by Adaptation Point C2-ERR-1.

column5: Maximum Number of Trackable Commands/Reports for OutRegistry
column6: Default value is 1.
column9: \texttt{\#DEFINE} constant in \texttt{CrFwOutRegistryUserPar.h} defines types, sub-types and range of discriminant values supported by application.

column5: Number of Service Types/Sub-Types supported by Application
column9: \texttt{\#DEFINE} constant in \texttt{CrFwOutRegistryUserPar.h} defines types, sub-types and range of discriminant values supported by application.

column5: Range of Services supported by Application
column9: \texttt{\#DEFINE} constant in \texttt{CrFwOutRegistryUserPar.h} defines types, sub-types and range of discriminant values supported by application.

column6: Returns 'check successful' if the maximum number of trackable commands/reports has been set to a positive integer value.
column9: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.

column5: Initialization Action in Initialization Procedure of OutRegistry (closes BAS-2)
column6: Allocate the resources for tracking the commands and reports and returns: 'action successful' if the allocation succeeds or 'action failed' if the allocation fails.
column9: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.

column5: Configuration Check in Reset Procedure of OutRegistry (closes BAS-3)
column6: Same value as in Base Component
column9: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.

column5: Configuration Action in Reset Procedure of OutRegistry (closes BAS-4)
column6: Set the enable state for all kinds of commands and reports to: 'enabled'; clear all information about tracked commands and reports; and return: 'action successful'.
column9: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.

column5: Shutdown Action of OutRegistry (closes BAS-5)
column6: Set the enable state for all kinds of commands and reports to: 'enabled'; clear all information about tracked commands and reports.
column9: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.

column5: Execution Procedure of OutRegistry (closes BAS-6)
column6: Same value as in Base Component
column9: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.

column5: Operations to Report the Outcome of the Processing and Execution of an Incoming Command
column9: Implementation of \texttt{CrFwRepInCmdOutcome.h}. Only a test stub is provided as default at framework level.

column5: Initialization Check in Initialization Procedure of InLoader (closes BAS-1)
column6: Return “check successful' iff the sizes of the LIM is a positive integer
column9: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.

column5: Initialization Action in Initialization Procedure of InLoader (closes BAS-2)
column6: Allocate resources for the LIM and return “Action Successful' iff the allocation succeeds
column9: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.

column5: Configuration Check in Reset Procedure of InLoader (closes BAS-3)
column6: Returns “check successful' if: (a) the information to update (or initialize) the content of the LIM is valid; and (b) the information to re-route packets is valid.
column9: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.

column5: Configuration Action in Reset Procedure of InLoader (closes BAS-4)
column6: (a) update (or initialize) content of LIM; and (b) update (or initialize) packet re-routing information.
column9: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.

column5: Shutdown Action of InLoader (closes BAS-5)
column6: Same as in Base Component.
column9: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.

column5: Execution Procedure of InLoader (closes BAS-6)
column6: Implemented as InLoader Execution Procedure.
column9: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.

column5: Size of List of InManagers in InLoader
column6: Default size is 2.
column9: The InLoader of the C2 Implementation does not explicitly define a List of InManager. This Adaptation Point is subsumed in the Adaptation Point for the selection of InManager (C2-ILD-TBD)

column5: Content of List of InManagers in InLoader
column6: No default provided at framework level.
column9: The InLoader of the C2 Implementation does not explicitly define a List of InManager. It only defines the function to return the InManager where the InReport or InCommand must be loaded (see C2-ILD-2).

column5: Operation to Determine Re-Routing Destination of Packets
column6: Re0routing destination is set to the destination of the incoming packet.
column9: Function pointer in \texttt{CrFwInLoaderUserPar.h}. Default implementation is provided \texttt{CrFwInLoader.h}.

column5: Operation to Get Packet Destination
column6: No default provided at framework level.
column9: Implemented by Adaptation Point C2-PCK-1.

column5: Operation to Check Packet Destination Validity
column6: Always returns “destination is valid'.
column9: The check of the destination validity is performed by the function which returns the re-routing destination.

column5: Operation to Report Packet Destination Invalid
column6: Generate error report INLOADER\_INV\_DEST with the destination identifier as a parameter
column9: Implemented by Adaptation Point C2-ERR-1.

column5: Operation to Get Packet Type
column6: No default provided at framework level
column9: Implemented by Adaptation Point C2-PCK-1.

column5: Operation to Report Acceptance Failure
column6: For InCommands: generate command acknowledge report CMD\_ACK\_ACC\_FAIL with command's identifier and with identifier of reason of failure as parameters.. For InReports: generate error report INLOADER\_ACC\_FAIL with report's identifier and with identifier of reason of acceptance failure as parameters.
column9: Implemented by Adaptation Point C2-ACK-1.

column5: Operation to Report Acceptance Success
column6: Generate command acknowledge report CMD\_ACK\_ACC\_SUCC with command's identifier as parameter.
column9: Implemented by Adaptation Point C2-ACK-1.

column5: Operation to Deserialize Packet
column6: No default provided at framework level.
column9: Packets are not deserialized in the C2 Implementation. Instead, the packet itself is attached to the component encapsulating the incoming report or command. This adaptation point is closed in the C2 Implementation.

column5: Operation to Select InManager where Incoming Report or Command is Loaded
column6: For InCommands, select first InManager in LIM; for InReport, select second InManager in LIM.
column9: Function pointer in \texttt{CrFwInLoaderUserPar.h}. Default implementation is provided \texttt{CrFwInLoader.h}.

column5: Operation to Check Packet Type Validity
column6: No default provided at framework level
column9: This check is implemented in function \textit{CrFwInFactoryMakeInCmd} for incoming command and in function \textit{CrFwInFactoryMakeInRep} for incoming report. These functions check that the type is supported by the application.

column5: Initialization Check in Initialization Procedure of InCommand
column6: Returns “check successful' if information for initializing InCommand using data in incoming packet is valid
column9: This Adaptation Point is closed in the C2 Implementation because InCommands are provided by the InFactory in the CONFIGURED state  (but a validity check is provided in C2-ICM-1 to implement the acceptance check).

column5: Initialization Action in Initialization Procedure of InCommand
column6: Use information in incoming packet to initialize InCommand and return “action successful'
column9: This Adaptation Point is closed in the C2 Implementation because InCommands are provided by the InFactory in the CONFIGURED state (but a validity check is provided in C2-ICM-1 to implement the acceptance check).

column5: Configuration Check in Reset Procedure of InCommand
column6: Returns “check successful' if information carried by packet is valid
column9: This Adaptation Point is closed in the C2 Implementation because InCommands are provided by the InFactory in the CONFIGURED state (but a validity check is provided in C2-ICM-1 to implement the acceptance check).

column5: Configuration Action in Reset Procedure of InCommand
column6: Use information in incoming packet to configure InCommand and return “action successful'
column9: This Adaptation Point is closed in the C2 Implementation because InCommands are provided by the InFactory in the CONFIGURED state (but a validity check is provided in C2-ICM-1 to implement the acceptance check).

column5: Validity Check for InCommand
column9: Function pointer in \texttt{CrFwInFactoryUserPar.h}. Default implementation which verifies correctness of CRC is provided by function \texttt{CrFwInCmdDefValidityCheck}.

column5: Shutdown Action of InCommand (closes BAS-5)
column6: Same value as in Base Component
column9: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.

column5: Execution Procedure of InCommand (closes BAS-6)

column9: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.

column5: Ready Check of InCommand
column6: Return “command is ready'
column9: Function pointer in \texttt{CrFwInFactoryUserPar.h}. Default implementation is provided by function \texttt{CrFwSmCheckAlwaysTrue}.

column5: Start Action of InCommand
column6: Set action outcome to “success'
column9: Function pointer in \texttt{CrFwInFactoryUserPar.h}. Default implementation is provided by function \texttt{CrFwSmEmptyAction}.

column5: Progress Action of InCommand
column6: Set action outcome to “completed'
column9: Function pointer in \texttt{CrFwInFactoryUserPar.h}. Default implementation is provided by function \texttt{CrFwSmEmptyAction}.

column5: Termination Action of InCommand
column6: Set action outcome to “success'
column9: Function pointer in \texttt{CrFwInFactoryUserPar.h}. Default implementation is provided by function \texttt{CrFwSmEmptyAction}.

column5: Abort Action of InCommand
column6: Do nothing
column9: Function pointer in \texttt{CrFwInFactoryUserPar.h}. Default implementation is provided by function \texttt{CrFwSmEmptyAction}.

column5: Operation to Report Start Failed for InCommand
column6: Generate command acknowledge report CMD\_ACK\_STR\_FAIL with command's identifier and with identifier of reason of failure as parameters.
column9: Implemented by Adaptation Point C2-ACK-1.

column5: Operation to Report Start Successful for InCommand
column6: Generate command acknowledge report CMD\_ACK\_STR\_SUCC with command's identifier as parameter.
column9: Implemented by Adaptation Point C2-ACK-1.

column5: Operation to Report Progress Failed for InCommand
column6: Generate command acknowledge report CMD\_ACK\_PRG\_FAIL with command's identifier, progress step and with identifier of reason of failure as parameters.
column9: Implemented by Adaptation Point C2-ACK-1.

column5: Operation to Report Progress Successful for InCommand
column6: Generate command acknowledge report CMD\_ACK\_PRG\_SUCC with command's identifier and progress step as parameters.
column9: Implemented by Adaptation Point C2-ACK-1.

column5: Operation to Report Termination Failed for InCommand
column6: Generate command acknowledge report CMD\_ACK\_TRM\_FAIL with command's identifier and with identifier of reason of failure as parameters.
column9: Implemented by Adaptation Point C2-ACK-1.

column5: Operation to Report Report Termination Successful for InCommand
column6: Generate command acknowledge report CMD\_ACK\_TRM\_FAIL with command's identifier as parameter.
column9: Implemented by Adaptation Point C2-ACK-1.

column9: Implemented by Adaptation Point C2-IFA-4.

column9: Implemented by Adaptation Point C2-IFA-4.

column5: Discriminant Attribute of InCommand

column9: Implemented by Adaptation Point C2-IFA-4.

column5: Parameter Attributes of InCommand
column6: Default value is: “no parameters'
column9: This Adaptation Point is implemented indirectly: applications must extend InCommands and must define the range of parameters for each kind of InCommand and the operations to get their values.

column9: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.

column9: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.

column5: Configuration Action in Reset Procedure of InManager (closes BAS-4)
column6: Release all InCommands and InReports in the PCRL; reset the counter of successfully loaded InCommands and InReports; reset the PCRL; and return “Action Successful'
column9: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.

column6: Release all InCommands and InReports in the PCRL; reset the PCRL;
column9: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.
